snippet: Most of the country’s production will stay with a state-owned company, but private investors will be able to bid on a portion of the reserves.
abstract: Mexico outlines changing landscape of its oil and gas industry as it tries to secure foreign assistance in developing its energy future; most of country's production will remain with state-owned Pemex, but private investors will be allowed to bid on some reserves.
lead_paragraph: Most of the country’s production will stay with a state-owned company, but private investors will be able to bid on a portion of the reserves.

headline.main: Mexico Opens Oil Fields to Foreigners
headline.print_headline: Mexico’s Oil Industry Is Opened to Foreigners
